alert.note: Alert for Coleman; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 4:22PM CDT until June 05 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, southwestern Coleman and southeastern Runnels. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM CDT, Radar indicated slow moving showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain over the border of southwestern Coleman and southeastern Runnels Counties. Rainfall amounts of three quarters of an inch to 1.5 inches have occurred, and an additional half to three quarters of an inch is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leaday and Talpa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
